item.title: What happens when labor and delivery contractions are too close together
item.description: When a pregnant woman goes to the labor and delivery unit of the hospital in labor, the standard of care requires continuous electronic fetal monitoring to keep a close eye on the baby’s well-being. Electronic fetal monitoring equipment displays and prints two separate lines. The top line measures the fetal heart rate and the bottom line measures the mom’s uterine contractions. Well-trained labor and delivery registered nurses and OB/GYN (obstetrician) physicians can obtain a wealth of information by interpreting fetal monitoring strips.
